title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showery weather conditions are expected to intensify over the island in the next few days.

title: Boats deployed to assist A/L candidates in flood hit areas of Galle and Matara
byline: Steps are being taken to facilitate transportation for students sitting for the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examination, after several areas in the Galle and Matara districts were inundated due to heavy rains, the Commissioner General of Examinations announced.

title: Minor flood warnings issued for several low-lying areas
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a warning of potential minor flooding in the upper and middle reaches of the Gin Ganga and Nilwala river basins due to the prevailing heavy rainfall.

title: Several persons trapped after landslide at Kadugannawa; Traffic restricted on Colombo-Kandy road
byline: UPDATE: One person has been confirmed died, four others have been hospitalised, and several remain trapped following the landslide near Ganetenna Junction in Kadugannawa, along the Colombo–Kandy main road.

title: Trump lavishes praise on New York’s mayor-elect Mamdani at warm White House meeting
byline: After months of trading insults, U.S. President Donald Trump and incoming New York City mayor Zohran Mamdani smiled at each other, swapped compliments and pledged to collaborate on tackling crime and affordability in the nation’s biggest city at an unexpectedly friendly meeting at the White House on Friday.

title: One dead, 4 hospitalised; Rescue operations continue after Kadugannawa landslide
byline: One person has been confirmed dead, four others have been hospitalised, and several remain trapped following the landslide near Ganetenna Junction in Kadugannawa, along the Colombo–Kandy main road.

title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ is officially eligible for the Oscars
byline: “KPop Demon Hunters” is one step closer to another golden moment: The Oscars. The Netflix phenomenon is among 35 films features eligible for the animated feature film category at the 98th Academy Awards.

title: ‘Game of Thrones’ is coming back — George R.R. Martin confirms sequel development
byline: Since ending in 2019, HBO’s Game of Thrones has since been expanded via another show called House of the Dragon.

title: Colombo–Kandy road completely closed at Ganethenna after landslide
byline: The Colombo–Kandy main road has been completely closed for vehicular traffic from the Ganethenna area in Kadugannawa due to a landslide.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Ukraine allies to hold talks at G20 on White House peace plan
byline: Ukraine’s allies will seek to “strengthen” a US plan to end the war with Russia when they meet at the G20 summit in South Africa, UK PM Sir Keir Starmer has said.

title: Woman trapped inside shop buried in Kadugannawa landslide rescued
byline: An injured woman who was trapped inside the shop buried by the landslide at Pahala Kadugannawa has been rescued and admitted to hospital, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: All Divisional Secretaries in Sri Lanka summoned to Colombo
byline: All Divisional Secretaries across the island have been summoned to Colombo for a special discussion to be held today (22), the President’s Media Division (PMD) announced.

title: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe visits Meenakshi Amman Temple in Madurai
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe visited the Meenakshi Amman Temple in Madurai on Saturday, months after securing bail in a high-profile public funds misuse case back home.

title: Govt launches programme to convert old petrol three-wheelers to electric
byline: The government has initiated a programme to convert old fuel-powered three-wheelers into electric vehicles, Minister of Science and Technology Chrishantha Abeysena announced.

title: Supreme Court Justice Shiran Gooneratne appointed as Acting Chief Justice
byline: Justice of the Supreme Court Anthony Lalith Shiran Gooneratne was sworn in as the Acting Chief Justice before President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (22) at the Presidential Secretariat, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Sri Lanka’s national initiatives align with China’s 15th five-year plan, says Ambassador
byline: “Partnering with China means embracing opportunities. Believing in China means being optimistic about the future. And investing in China means investing in tomorrow,” said Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong, highlighting the long-standing friendship between the two countries.

title: Train services on coastal line restricted to Weligama following derailment
byline: The Railway Department has announced that train operations on the Coastal Railway Line will be restricted up to Weligama until further notice.

title: Kadugannawa landslide death toll rises to 2 as rescued man succumbs to injuries
byline: A man who was earlier rescued from the Pahala Kadugannawa landslide site has succumbed to his injuries, bringing the total number of fatalities to two, hospital sources confirmed.

title: US mulls letting Nvidia sell H200 chips to China, sources say
byline: The Trump administration is considering greenlighting sales of Nvidia’s H200 artificial intelligence chips to China, people familiar with the matter said, as a bilateral detente boosts prospects for exports of advanced U.S. technology to China.

title: Pahala Kadugannawa landslide death toll rises to five
byline: Another individual trapped in the Pahala Kadugannawa landslide has been found dead, raising the total number of fatalities to five, according to hospital sources.

title: Earthquake jolts Bangladesh again; third in 2 days
byline: Bangladesh experienced another earthquake at 6:06pm today (22 November), a day after a powerful 5.7-magnitude earthquake jolted the country yesterday.

title: Kadugannawa landslide death toll rises to 4 as two more bodies recovered
byline: The bodies of two more individuals who were trapped in the Pahala Kadugannawa landslide have been recovered, raising the total number of fatalities to four, according to the Disaster Management Centre.

title: Flood warnings issued for several areas due to heavy rainfall
byline: Flood warnings have been issued to several areas by the Department of Irrigation owing to the prevailing heavy rainfall across the country.

title: Death toll in Pahala Kadugannawa landslide climbs to six, rescue operation concludes
byline: Another individual trapped in the Pahala Kadugannawa landslide has been found dead, bringing the total number of confirmed fatalities to six.

title: Section of Kandy-Colombo Road at Pahala Kadugannawa closed until tomorrow afternoon
byline: A section of the Colombo-Kandy main road, which was closed this morning (22) following a landslide in the Ganethenna area of Pahala Kadugannawa, will remain closed until tomorrow (23) afternoon, Kegalle District Secretary Jagath M. Herath said.

title: Landslide warnings issued for several districts extended
byline: Early landslide warning issued for several areas of the island owing to the prevailing heavy rain, have been extended.
